\displaystyle{T}_{{G}} is the temperature at ground level in Fahrenheit
\displaystyle{A} is the height above ground level in feet
If the temperature on the ground is \displaystyle{54}^{\circ}, what will it be at 3700 feet above ground level?
Answers should be rounded to the units place.

solution.p: The model for this situation is \displaystyle{T}_{{A}}={54}-\frac{{{3.5}}}{{{1000}}}{A}.
Because we want to estimate the temperature at 3700 ft AGL, we calculate \displaystyle{T}_{{A}}={54}-\frac{{{3.5}}}{{{1000}}}{3700}={41.05}\approx{41}
